FuncDef: The reset igmp-snooping listening-group command clears member interface information of multicast groups on QinQ stacking or mapping sub-interfaces.
CLIs: reset igmp-snooping listening-group { all | interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } [ pe-vid <vlan-id> [ ce-vid <vlan-id> ] [ <group-address> [ mask { <mask-address> | <mask-length> } ] [ <source-address> [ mask { <mask-address> | <mask-length> } ] ] ] ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Clears member interface information of all multicast groups.
-

Clears member interface information of multicast groups on a specified sub-interface.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Specifies an outer VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies an inner VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies a multicast group address.
The value is a Class D IP address, in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of a multicast group address.
-

Specifies the mask of a multicast source address.
-

Specifies the mask in the format of an IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask in the format of an IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Specifies the mask length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Specifies a multicast source address.
The value is a Class A, B, or C IP address, in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To clear member interface information of multicast groups on QinQ stacking or mapping sub-interfaces, run the reset igmp-snooping listening-group command.
